conclusion: Two particles, A and B, are placed on the same horizontal plane and start moving in a straight line simultaneously from rest, from the same position, and in the same direction.
The v-t (velocity-time) graph of their motion is shown in the figure.
Particle A and particle B start together at t = 0.

premise: From 0 to t0 both have the same velocity–time line.
conclusion: From 0 to t0, A and B stay together.

premise: Between t0 and 3 t0 the area under A’s v-t graph exceeds that under B’s.
conclusion: Between t0 and 3 t0, A moves ahead of B.

premise: From 3 t0 to 5 t0 A’s velocity is smaller than B’s.
conclusion: From 3 t0 to 5 t0, B closes the gap with A.

premise: The areas between the two curves from 0 to 3 t0 and from 3 t0 onward are equal at t = 5 t0.
conclusion: At t = 5 t0, their net displacements from the start are again the same.

premise: The areas enclosed by the v-t graph and the coordinate axes represent displacement.
conclusion: When the areas enclosed by the graphs of A and B with the coordinate axes are equal, A and B meet.

premise: From the graph, it can be seen that at t = 6t0, the displacements of A and B are equal.
conclusion: At t = 6t0, A and B meet.
